meanings.definition: A building where cattle are kept.
meanings.sent1: The shippon on the farm is where the cows sleep at night.
meanings.sent2: The farmer built a new shippon to shelter the cattle from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The shippon became the cows' favorite hangout spot on hot days.
meanings.sent4: The shippon stood tall like a fortress protecting the cows from the elements.
meanings.sent5: The shippon echoed with the peaceful sounds of content cows.

meanings.definition: To house cattle in a shippon.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will shippon the cows before the storm arrives.
meanings.sent2: She shippons the cattle every evening before sunset.
meanings.sent3: The cows always cooperate when she shippons them into the barn.
meanings.sent4: He shipponed the cows swiftly, ensuring they were safe from the cold.
meanings.sent5: Shipponing the cattle is a daily routine for the farmer.

meanings.definition: The act of keeping cattle in a shippon.
meanings.sent1: Her shippon of the cows was done with care and precision.
meanings.sent2: The shippon of the cattle was necessary to protect them from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The shippon of the cows turned into a race against the setting sun.
meanings.sent4: The shippon of the cattle was a sight to behold as they all filed in orderly.
meanings.sent5: The shippon of the cows was a daily chore for the farmer.
